90NPC attack style: File:Attack-icon.png

Dark beasts are large, bull-like monsters requiring level 90 Slayer to harm. They attack with melee. The Iorwerth Clan encountered dark beasts in the Mourner Tunnels during the Elven Civil War, and they often killed the slaves that the Iorwerth Clan were using to find the Temple of Light.

A Mask of Gloom (and its upgraded variant) can be used to have Slayer Masters give you the option of taking a dark beast task once a day, provided that you are wearing it. The dark beast assignment token also has similar mechanics, but only works on Morvran.

Dark beasts are well known for their slightly uncommon blue charm drop, the dark bow, and dark arrowheads. They are the only creatures that drop death talismans. They are also good droppers of the rare drop table, and are one of the slayer monsters to drop the crystal triskelion fragment.

While dark beasts can only be accessed by members, their lower-level revenant counterparts are on both member and free to play worlds. If assigned as a Slayer task, revenant dark beasts may take their place, although this is not recommended due to their higher combat stats and single spawn with a slow spawn rate. When killing dark beasts, an elite version may spawn (guaranteed while on a Slayer assignment), which can be further increased with the use of fellstalk incense sticks and tier 3 luck.

Using good ranged equipment, soul split, a bonecrusher and demon horn necklace, a player can stay as long as they want as their defence is quite low for their level.

Completing 8 dark beast tasks assigned by Morvran will unlock the [Name], of the Iorwerth title.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Morytania Slayer Tower dungeon101None14Maplink
Kuradal's Dungeon101None6Maplink
Mourner Tunnels101None19Maplink
Forinthry Dungeon101None9Maplink
North of The Forgotten Cemetery101None13Maplink

If the player is killing dark beasts for a Slayer assignment then they can gain 20% additional Slayer experience by equipping a demonic skull. They can gain another 20% extra experience per kill if they accept a special slayer contract from Erskine while assigned dark beasts as a Slayer task. These experience bonuses stack, meaning the player may gain 40% extra Slayer experience. Completing a special slayer contract rewards the player with a choice of coins or combat experience.

The dark beasts in the Forinthry Dungeon are the same as other dark beasts; the ones north of The Forgotten Cemetery have just over double the health.

If fighting dark beast north of The Forgotten Cemetery, there is a safe spot available just left of the tree stumps (middle of the bottom two stumps). 3 different Dark Beasts can be safely killed from this position without taking damage when using long range weapons.

Safe spot in Wilderness.

Wilderness shared loot table[edit | edit source]

This monster has access to the Wilderness shared loot table, which is a tertiary drop. To access the table, it has to be killed inside the Wilderness.
Luck-enhancing items are not required to access the table, but do increase the chance of doing so, as does doing higher-level content.

The following money making guide is available for Dark beast:

Killing dark beasts3,329,657
  • 90+
  • 96+ (recommended) for Overload
  • 60+ (recommended) for Bonecrusher + Split dragontooth necklace or Demon horn necklace
  • Spring cleaner highly recommended
  • Upgraded Seedicide recommended

    Update history[edit | edit source]

    This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
    • patch 15 May 2023 (Update):
      • Dark beasts (excluding revenant dark beasts and the Helm of Darkness' dark beast emote) have been graphically updated.
      • Dark beasts no longer inexplicably shoot a fireball at the player.
        • Their primary attack style has been changed from magic to melee.
    • patch 13 March 2023 (Update):
      • Moved the dark beasts from the necrite mine to the area north of the Forgotten Cemetery, as they kept aggro'ing players killing lava strykewyrms.
    • patch 8 August 2022 (Update):
      • Dark beasts in the Wilderness now drop loot matching other dark beasts.
    • patch 4 May 2020 (Update):
      • Adamantite stone spirits have been replaced by necrite stone spirits.
    • patch 5 August 2019 (Update):
      • Dark beasts are now bored of imitating Ganodermic Beasts and once again sound as expected.
    • patch 12 June 2017 (Update):
      • Dark Beasts max hit has been changed back to 600 from 1080.
    • patch 5 June 2017 (Update):
      • Protection Prayers at Dark Beasts now reduce damage by 50% instead of 95%.
        • Before this update, Protect/Deflect magic reduced their damage by 95%.
        • Their max hit was also increased to 1,080, though this was unintentional. This was reverted on 12 June 2017.
    • ninja 25 April 2016 (Update):
      • Improved respawn rates for Dark Beasts.
    • ninja 9 June 2014 (Update):
      • The drop rate of sirenic scales from airut and dark beasts has been reduced.
    • patch 4 March 2013 (Update):
      • Dark beasts’ magic attacks now display hit splats at the correct point in the animation.
    • patch 11 April 2012 (Update):
      • Dark beasts now drop big bones.
    • hidden 11 June 2007 (Update):
      • Graphically updated with the release of the dark bow.
      • Renamed from "Dark Beast" to "Dark beast".
      • The dark beast's skill guide icon was graphically updated.
    • update 17 October 2005 (Update):
      • Added to game.

    Trivia[edit | edit source]

    • Dark beasts were involved in the God Wars, as evidenced by the revenant dark beasts located in the Forinthry Dungeon.
    • Dark beasts used to drop normal bones, despite being a large monster. This was changed on 11 April 2012 to big bones, which also gave them a chance to drop long bones and curved bones.
    • There was a bug affecting dark beasts, causing them to sound like ganodermic beasts. This was patched on 5 August 2019. The change reverted the audio to a much older file.
    • On 13 October 2014, dark beasts were one of many monsters to receive a reworked drop table.
    • Dark beasts resemble an ancient rhinoceros species named Elasmotherium. Both have large, stocky bodies, and very large horns on the face.
    • On 15 May 2023, their attack style and was changed from magic to melee. They retained the weakness to bolts they already had.
    • As of 1 February 2018, the highest kill count for this monster was 1,239,731 kills.[1]
      • This had increased to 1,415,899 by 6 May 2018.[2] At this time, these were the most killed monsters of those tracked.
